definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Why is it necessary to have both a Doorman and Bellboy on stand by?
sentences.chinese: 为什么门童和行李员都有必要准备迎接客人？

sentences.english: If you slipped the doorman $10 he'll let you in.
sentences.chinese: 你如果悄悄塞给门童十美元，他就会让你进去。

sentences.english: He looked like a manager, but in fact he is no more than a bellboy.
sentences.chinese: 他看起来象个经理，但事实上他只是个门童。

sentences.english: My wife smiles at the concierge and he smiles back.
sentences.chinese: 我的妻子对酒店门童微笑，他也以微笑回报。

sentences.english: Doormen often wear elaborate uniforms that are meant to give the hotel an elegant note.
sentences.chinese: 门童通常穿着精致的制服，给宾馆一种优雅的感觉。

definition: abbr. for 侍應生|侍应生[shi4 ying4 sheng1]
to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to ensure public security/to ensure safety (for workers engaged in production)/public security/security guard
